meanings.definition: To extract oil or gas from a rock formation by injecting liquid at high pressure.
meanings.sent1: The workers will frack the ground to get the oil out.
meanings.sent2: Companies often frack to access natural gas reserves.
meanings.sent3: I heard they want to frack the rocks to make them give up their secrets!
meanings.sent4: The idea of using high pressure to frack the rocks is quite innovative.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the liquid being injected to frack the rock was deafening.

meanings.definition: A swear word used as a euphemism for a stronger expletive.
meanings.sent1: He let out a loud frack when he dropped his phone.
meanings.sent2: Some people use frack instead of other curse words.
meanings.sent3: The toddler surprised everyone by shouting 'frack' at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't help but giggle at the sound of 'frack' coming from her grandpa.
meanings.sent5: The teacher raised an eyebrow at the student's creative use of 'frack' in class.
